data.title: Best 'Pokemon Go' Teams for the Catch Cup League
meta_keywords: Pokemon GO Guide Best Teams Catch Cup
Pokemon GO Guide Best Team Catch Cup November 2020
Pokemon GO Guide Catch Cup League 2020
Pokemon GO Guide Catch Cup League November 2020
data.meta_description: Pokemon GO's exclusive league is now launching for players to enjoy and here's how to maximize the event!
data.text:
"Pokemon GO" is debuting the Catch Cup League limited-time event for trainers to enjoy globally, and it demands specific Pokemon to join one's team lineup to participate. The Catch Cup League would run from Monday, November 23, to next week, Monday, November 30, with unique event requirements for trainers to participate and follow. Here's our list of best Pokemon teams to use.

Niantic, Inc.'s "Pokemon GO" is back to bring a weekly event for players to participate in and enjoy, with the Catch Cup League's debut early Monday. This event is open for all trainers to enjoy, offering rewarding prizes and event-special prizes that will surely bring trainer needs.

'Pokemon GO' Catch Cup League: Best Teams Lineups

According to Reddit's r/TheSilphArena, there would be numerous Fire and Electric-type Pokemon that would present a massive threat to players, so it would be ideal to use Steel and Flying-types to counter. Pokemon, including Magmar, Electabuzz, Venasaur, Azumarill, Galarian Stunfisk, and Whimsicott, are the most common opponents.

(Photo : Pokemon GO / Twitter)

"Pokemon GO" will have two Community Days for this month.

Team Lineups:

Hypno, Marowak (Alola), Scrafty, and Skarmory

Ferrothorn, Mantyke, Medicham, Skarmory

Altaria, Azumarill, Sirfetch'd, Whiscash, Wigglytuff

'Pokemon GO' Catch Cup League: Choices are Limited to Special Requirements

Anyone can join the Catch Cup League; however, certain demands and specifications may hinder the majority of trainers to join the latest event. The rewards for "Pokemon GO's" Catch Cup awaits lucky trainers, making it a worthwhile event to participate and join.

According to Gamer Journalist, "Pokemon GO" demands people to bring teams with Pokemon caught from November 9 onwards. Older Pokemon would not be accepted by the game when entering the Catch Cup League's week-long event.

Additionally, Pokemon from egg hatches are allowed, provided that they were collected and opened during the start of Season 5 or later. The game's provisions are amping up the challenge for gamers to join the limited weekly event, having smaller choices for Pokemon to use, and having no time to cultivate and strengthen its team.

Read Also: 'Pokemon GO' Guide: Here are the Tasks and XP Required to Reach Level 41 to 50

'Pokemon GO' Catch Cup League: Best Teams to Join Limited Event

The limited choices may present a huge challenge for gamers as there would be so little time to prepare. The event's conditions were only given during early November and comes as a surprise for most trainers who wish to join the tournament.

Even so, several Pokemon available out there, and trainers would need to venture, go on raids, and cultivate its team a little longer to ensure smooth gameplay and better chances at winning. When going out, remember these Pokemon that trainers can easily find and catch.

Pokemon to Find and Catch Easily:

Altaria - Dragon and Flying-type

Ferrothorn - Steel and Grass-type

Hypno - Psychic-type

Marowak (Alola Form) - Fire and Ghost-type

Mantyke - Flying and Water-type

Medicham - Fighting and Psychic-type

Scrafty - Dark and Fighting-type

Sirfetch'd - Fighting-type

Skarmory - Steel and Flying-type

Whiscash - Ground and Water-type

Wigglytuff - Fairy and Normal-type
